channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet the New Zero-Down Mortgage + Why Lumber Prices Are Dropping
item.description: Zero-down mortgages are back. That’s right. You can now get into a home with (potentially) zero dollars out-of-pocket. But wait…this is starting to sound a bit like 2008. Remember the […]

item.title: Apple gives developers a way to nominate their apps for editorial consideration on the App Store
item.description: From a new Nominations dashboard in App Store Connect, developers will be able to create their nominations, either one by one or by uploading a spreadsheet to nominate apps in bulk. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Serving Time for Their Abusers’ Crimes
item.description: The Marshall Project found nearly 100 people who were punished for the actions of their abusers under little-known laws like “accomplice liability.”

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: Landlord Guide to Rental Property Emergency Repairs
item.description: It’s important for all landlords to understand what counts as an emergency repair, how to plan proactively, and how to manage emergency situations when they happen.

item.title: What StepStone’s $3.3B venture secondaries fund tells us about LPs’ current appetite for venture
item.description: StepStone raised the largest fund dedicated to investing in venture secondaries ever, the firm announced last week. This fundraise doesn’t just say a lot about StepStone’s venture secondaries investing prowess, but also about how LPs are thinking about the current venture market. The fund, StepStone VC Secondaries Fund VI, raised $3.3 billion. This marks a […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Behind the Black Shield: The History of a Cleveland Institution
item.description: How one of the oldest Black policing organizations in the country shaped law enforcement in Cleveland.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: How to Write a Rental Property Listing That Attracts Quality Tenants Quickly
item.description: It’s not good enough to write a rental property listing. You must know how to write a rental property listing that quickly attracts high-quality tenants.

item.title: Spotify announces an in-house creative agency, tests generative AI voiceover ads
item.description: Spotify announced on Thursday that it’s venturing further into the ad space with its first in-house creative agency called Creative Lab, helping brands create custom marketing campaigns. It will also begin testing generative AI ads, the company said. The launch of Creative Lab shows that Spotify is ramping up its efforts to attract advertisers to […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 5 Takeaways From Our Series on St. Louis Homicide Investigations
item.description: The police department has struggled to solve homicides, partly due to shoddy detective work, staffing shortages and eroding community trust.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: What It Takes for Investors to Build a Powerful Lead List and Keep Deals Flowing
item.description: This article is presented by DealMachine. Read our editorial guidelines for more information. A well-built, up-to-date lead list is an essential component of success in real estate investing. Whether you are a seasoned […]

item.title: Here’s everything Apple announced at the WWDC 2024 keynote, including Apple Intelligence, Siri makeover
item.description: The TechCrunch team runs down all of the biggest news from the Apple WWDC 2024 keynote in an easy-to-skim digest. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Were in a Mental Health Crisis at a Hospital. This Is How They Landed in Jail.
item.description: Washington, like most states, has a law intended to protect health care workers. Instead, it’s led to prosecutions of people with severe mental illness.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: Texas Has Some of the Fastest-Growing Cities in the United States—Should You Invest Before It’s Too Late?
item.description: Everything is bigger in Texas—including the growth of some of its most under-the-radar cities. According to the latest U.S. Census Bureau figures, between July 2022 and July 2023, eight of […]

item.title: Tesla shareholders sue Musk for starting competing AI company
item.description: Tesla shareholders are suing CEO Elon Musk and members of the automaker’s board of directors over Musk’s decision to start xAI, which they say is a competing AI company, and then divert talent and resources from Tesla to the new startup. The lawsuit is one of the most direct challenges to Musk’s decision to start […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Why Some States are Trying to Get People Medicaid Before They Leave Prison
item.description: People leaving prisons and jails are at greater risk of illness and death, but for years they couldn’t use the government health insurance program.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
